type Nick = ByteStringSource

The Nickname of a user

type Channel = ByteStringSource

An IRC channel

type Flags = Maybe [(String, Maybe String)]Source

Flags the User is providing to the Bot

type IRC = StateT Bot IOSource

Our IRC Monad

data ArgT Source

A single argument as supplied to a function.

Constructors

Varidic

The function can take any number of arguments

Void

The function takes no arguments

String

The function takes a string as an argument

Int

The function takes a (32-Bit) Integer as an argument

Double

The function takes a (64-Bit) double as an argument

Instances

Read ArgT 
Show ArgT 

data Permission Source

Represents the Permission that is neccessary to call a Module i.e the permission the Module is requesting the user to have.

Note that this data differs from the levels of permission someone is able to assume.

Constructors

Admin

Having the highest possible priority, Admins are always able to execute a Module.

ANY

Next is ANY, i.e the Module is not requesting the user to have any special permissions.

Privileged

Only privileged users and above are allowed to execute

Registered

Only registered users and above are allowed to execute

UnRegistered

Having the lowest possible priority, UnRegistered is only able to execute if ANY or UnRegistered is set.

Instances

Eq Permission 
Ord Permission 
Show Permission 

data Bot Source

Bot is carrying all the data we need in order to dispatch queries.

Constructors

Bot 

Fields

iSock :: Handle

The Socket that's connected to the server.

starttime :: ClockTime

The starttime, for uptime tracking (not yet implemented)

modCnt :: Integer

A counter containing the number of Modules tracked

aliasDB :: [(ByteString, ByteString)]

Aliases that are set

userDB :: Map Nick Permission

Users that have Registered

channelDB :: [Channel]

Channels the Bot joined

data GenericIRC Source

GenericIRC holds information contained in a single line of input coming from the server. (see parseIRC)

Where the Message is coming from. Note this may also be a User, not only a Channel.

The actual Message.

data IRCCommand Source

A message coming from the user directed to the Bot (not referring to a native call)

Constructors

IRCCommand 

Fields

qModule :: String

the Module the user attempts to call

qFunc :: String

the Function the user attempts to call

qArgs :: Maybe [String]

Arguments the user is delivering to the function

qFlags :: Flags

Flags the user is transmitting to the Bot

data ModuleCall Source

Information that is neccessary in order to start a module
